titleStmt.title: William McNeil Clough to James W. Tate
CWG2594

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
"BE PROMPT. ACCURATE AND FAITHFUL. IN THE PERFORMANCE OF ALL ACCEPTED TRUSTS."
WILLIAM MCNEILL CLOUGH
ATTORNEY AT LAW & NOTARY PUBLIC,
PARKVILLE, PLATTE COUNTY, MO.
J. McKittrick & Co. Lithogos. 26 N. Main St. St. Louis, Mo.

COLLECTIONS PROMPTLY ATTENDED TO IN THE COUNTIES OF PLATTE, CLAY, CLINTON, BUCHANAN & JACKSON AS ALSO IN KANSAS TERRIT.
BANKABLE COLLECTIONS CAREFULLY ATTENDED TO AND PROCEEDS REMITTED AT CURRENT RATES OF EXCHANGE.
HE REFERS BY PERMISSION, TO

LUCAS. THOMPSON & CO.,
WOODS. CHRISTY & CO.,
FISKE. KNIGHT & CO.,
CHILD, PRATT & FOX.
E. A. & S. R. FILLEY. }

BARNARD & CO.,
LEWIS HEIMER,
SHAPLEIGH, DAY & CO.,
WEBSTER & MARSH & CO.,
MARTIN & BRHER, } St. Louis

SITER, PRICE & CO.,
WOOD, BACON & CO.,
ABBOTT, JOHNES & CO.,
CONRAD, THOMPSON & CO.,
M. WILLIAMSON & CO., } Philadelphia

NORTHRUP & CO., Bankers, Kansas City, Mo.
SCOTT, KERR & CO., " Leavenworth, K. T.
SMOOT, RUSSELL & CO., " "
GEORGE T. HULSE, " Weston, Mo.
Wm. H. BARKSDALE & COL., " St. Louis, Mo.

Parkville, Mo. November 4th 1861.
James W. Tate Esqr.
Asst. Sec'y. of State, Frankfort, Ky.

Dear Sir. Herewith enclosed please find five dollars, for which please send me new Commission, as Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky, resident in this state. Please also enclose therewith your latest instructions & forms to Commissioners.

Very Resp. Yours etc.
William McNeill Clough.

Missouri
Wm McN. Clough
Comr. of Deeds
Parkville
Comd. Nov. 9. 1861
